lines.text:
[to Emily]
Pardon me, but did I see you in "Rebecca?"

[after seeing Emily for the first time]
Zounds! What well did she come out of?

[he and Melody collide and are wearing each other's clothes]
Odds bodkins, we're all mixed up!
[they run into each other again and get back into their own clothes]
Melody, don't ever do that again, I'm a boy!
Here's a horse pistol.
[Gives him the gun. Horatio turns to the horse behind him]
Here, this is for you.

[to June about Dr. Greenway]
Last week he said that the rash I had wasn't an allergy, it was a guilt complex because I kicked your grandmother in the bustle when I was 2 years old.
What's the matter, Tom?
Bottles flying through the air, glasses filling themselves up, and somebody tooted into my stethoscope!
Horatio, be patient.
Be patient? Melody, do you realize that my Nora has been waiting on me for 165 years? And a girl will only wait so long, and no longer!

[turning on the house's electric lights]
Amazing... must've got it from Benjamin Franklin, he's always inventing things.

[contacting the ghosts]
Are you the spirits of the traitors in the well?
[Horatio raps once for 'no', hits Cuthbert on the foot]
OUCH!

[Calling to the ghosts of the well]
Analog dos mirabus spirae cuttar, nimbus hypnosticos lazzum bid-dar.
There she goes again. It must be number one on her Hit Parade.

[in a trance and speaking with the voice of Thomas Danbury]
Melody, my beloved, it's Tom. I've come to help you.
Oh, Shelly, what does it mean?
It-it must be Danbury speaking through Emily.
Oh, fine. A ghost to ghost broadcast.
Cuthbert, Melody, it's Cuthbert! He's still alive!
How can that be?
I don't know, they say only the good die young.
I don't want those people coming around here saying,
[singing]
Here lie the dirty traitors! Here lie the dirty traitors!
[crying]
Here lie the dirty traitors.
I need help.

[With his head sticking out of a trunk]
What do you think I need? Mistress Melody, would you help me get out of this overcoat?
Emily! When you came in here just now, did you or did you not kick me?
Certainly not.

[getting worried]
Oh!

[hears machine gunfire]
It must be the radio downstairs!
Well it's not the American Revolution!

[Horatio picks up the phone receiver]
Number please.
Spooks!
[runs over to Melody]
That thing just talked to me!

[Horatio and Nora are laying in the hay, Nora kisses him, he gasps and stutters]
Nora!
Oh Horatio, do my kisses thrill you that much?
I'm sitting on a pitchfork!
This is the first pleasure I've had in 165 years.

[about the ghosts]
I must go to them.
[takes the tray of brandy with her]
Wait a minute, better leave that with us.
[takes the brandy]
We need it more than the ghosts do.

[picks up a book]
Tom Danbury's memoirs.
His grandmas?

[Tom's voice is coming through Emily]
Horatio, why can't I see him?
You poor kid, you can't. You see, he's got his wings, and we're still grounded.
If he had a letter from George Washington, then he couldn't have been a traitor.

[raps on the table]
That's right!
Now don't tell me we're going to stay up the rest of the night contacting George Washington!
